location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.6A of 1854 from Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Henry Anderson, Secretary to the Government of Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter relates to the payment of compensation to the victims of piracy in the Gulf. Kemball writes to reassure Government that the orders of the Honourable Court of Directors, to pay damages directly to the victims of acts of piracy rather than to their chiefs, will be strictly observed, and that this has been communicated to Shaikh Sultan ben Suggur [Sultan bin Saqr].
